intro: Adesmia capitellata, commonly known as the yellow bursaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is a shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in heads, and the leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Adesmia capitellata is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine by local communities.
